revised_title: Investigating the Effects of Nutrient Salt Deficiency on Photosynthetic Activity in Plants
tldr: The authors conducted experiments on Phaseolus vulgaris plants grown in nutrient solution with varying deficiencies of essential nutrient salts. They found that a deficiency in magnesium, iron, or phosphorus reduced the plants' photosynthetic activity, both when light and temperature were limiting factors. This study highlights the importance of nutrient salts in maintaining optimal photosynthetic activity and plant growth.
